title.narrative: SUR 3.2 DATA, EVIDENCE AND M&E

description.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacity to systematically collect, analyse and use disaggregated data and other forms of information to monitor, inform policy decision-making and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimensions, using an equity-based approach, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the life cycle and building their resilience through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies based on adequately disaggregated data on children

description.narrative: ;In 2021, UNICEF Suriname continued to harness the power of evidence to drive changes for children in the country through advocacy and evidence-based programming. The SITAN was rolled out and completed; to inform development of the next Country Programme and UNICEF;advocacy;on;key;issues;affecting;children;rights. Advocacy and strong partnership with the General bureau for Statistics and Foreign Affairs led to the agreement to implement the multi-dimensional child poverty analysis; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/01/2022
